title: How to Add Autotext in Word

steps.title: Highlight the content that you want to make an AutoText entry.
steps.content: Highlight the content that you want to make an AutoText entry. This can be text-only or text and photos. If you're using Microsoft Word 2010 or earlier, you'll need to add the AutoText Gallery to the Quick Access Toolbar. Here's how: Click the Office button in the upper left corner of the Word window and select Word Options . Click Customize . Select All Commands in the left dropdown selection box. Scroll down to the "AutoText entry" and double-click to move it to the right pane. Click OK to close the options window.

steps.title: Click the Insert tab.
steps.content: Click the Insert tab. It's at the top of Word.

steps.title: Click the Quick Parts menu.
steps.content: Click the Quick Parts menu. It's in the toolbar that runs along the top of the screen. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Click the AutoText menu.
steps.content: Click the AutoText menu. This opens your AutoText Gallery, which is where you'll find your AutoText in the future. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Save Selection to AutoText Gallery.
steps.content: Click Save Selection to AutoText Gallery . It's at the bottom of the list. This opens a form.

steps.title: Fill out your AutoText preferences and click OK.
steps.content: Fill out your AutoText preferences and click OK . You can give the AutoText snippet a name, description, and other information to make it easy to identify when inserting text. This saves the selected snippet to your AutoText Gallery for later use.

steps.title: Open the document in which you want to insert AutoText.
steps.content: Open the document in which you want to insert AutoText. It can be any document; not just the one you used to create the AutoText.

steps.title: Click the location where you want to insert AutoText.
steps.content: Click the location where you want to insert AutoText. This places the cursor at the location.

steps.title: Click the Insert tab.
steps.content: Click the Insert tab. It's at the top of Word.

steps.title: Click Quick Parts.
steps.content: Click Quick Parts . It's in the toolbar that runs along the top of the screen. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Select AutoText on the menu.
steps.content: Select AutoText on the menu. This opens the AutoText Gallery.

steps.title: Click the AutoText you'd like to insert.
steps.content: Click the AutoText you'd like to insert. This inserts the AutoText selection where you placed the cursor.
